intro: Paurolepis angusta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pellitory, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered umbels of white flowers. The plant has finely divided, aromatic leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
